entry.title: value help dropdown itself to show an explicit <empty> option?
entry.content:
I am working with a Value Help based on the annotation:

{
    $Type: 'Common.ValueListParameterIn',
    InitialValueIsSignificant: true,
    LocalDataProperty: id,
    ValueListProperty: 'ID'
}

InitialValueIsSignificant = true works correctly — if the field is empty, the value help filters for id eq '' and returns the correct results.

However, I also need the value help dropdown itself to show an explicit <empty> option, so that the user can actively choose an empty/null value.

Is there a standard way (annotation, UI5 parameter, or OData approach) to include an explicit <empty> option in a Value Help dropdown for a ValueListParameterIn?

entry.title: is there an option to configure alerts in SAPforme for Consumption thresholds?
entry.content: customer wants to cap their users ( entitlement for RISE) use once they reach their entitlement threshold (100%) . Is there is an alert monitoring feature in SAP 4 Me that a customer can turn on to monitor their RISE consumption or for that matter any license consumption metrics (which is seen in the Consumption tab) ?

entry.title: Insert a New Row into table at a specific Index using Odata v4
entry.content:
Hi Forum,

I have an issue , Please help me in resolving it!!!

When I am trying to create a row with the following code:

// Get the list binding from the table's "items" aggregation
var oListBinding = oTable.getBinding("items");
var oInitialData = {
"site": "1000",
"storage_location":"1234",
"article_doc_num": "1234",
"article_doc_num_itm":"1"
};
// Create a new entry (context)
var oNewContext = oListBinding.create(oInitialData);

The new row is getting created at the beginning of the table, but I want the row to be added at a specific index.


Please suggest a solution for this.

entry.title: HTML5 Application Migrated from NEO to Cloud Foundry Not Visible in BTP / Build Work Zone
entry.content:
We have a basic HTML (SAPUI5) application running on SAP NEO, which we are currently testing to migrate to SAP BTP Cloud Foundry.

We have completed the required configurations on the Cloud Foundry side and updated the following files accordingly:

  • xs-app.json

  • mta.yaml

  • xs-security.json

  • manifest.json

We successfully build the MTAR file and deploy it from SAP Business Application Studio (BAS). The deployment completes without any errors.

However, after deployment:

  • The application does not appear under HTML5 Applications in the SAP BTP cockpit

  • The application is also not visible in SAP Build Work Zone

  • We have already created an instance of HTML5 Application Repository Service with the app-host plan

Could you please help us understand:

  1. What could be the possible reasons for the application not appearing in HTML5 Applications or Build Work Zone?

  2. Are there any mandatory configurations or services (such as app-runtime, destination, XSUAA, or content module settings) that are commonly missed during NEO to Cloud Foundry migration?

  3. Are there any specific checks or logs we should verify after a successful MTAR deployment?

Any guidance or best practices for migrating HTML5 applications from NEO to Cloud Foundry would be greatly appreciated.

mta.yaml:

_schema-version: "3.2"
ID: test.getuserdetailsmta
version: 0.0.1
description: Generated by Fiori Tools

modules:
  - name: testgetuserdetailsmta-app-content
    type: com.sap.application.content
    path: .
    requires:
      - name: testgetuserdetailsmta-repo-host
      #- name: testgetuserdetailsmta-html5-runtime_new
        parameters:
          content-target: true
      - name: testgetuserdetailsmta-destination-service
    build-parameters:
      build-result: resources
      requires:
        - name: testgetuserdetailsmta
          artifacts:
            - dist.zip
          target-path: resources/

  - name: testgetuserdetailsmta
    type: html5
    path: .
    parameters:
      buildpack: nodejs_buildpack
    requires:
      - name: testgetuserdetailsmta-xsuaa
    build-parameters:
      builder: custom
      commands:
        - npm install
        - npm run build:cf
      build-result: dist
      supported-platforms: []

resources:
  - name: testgetuserdetailsmta-repo-host
    type: org.cloudfoundry.managed-service
    parameters:
      service: html5-apps-repo
      service-plan: app-host
      service-name: testgetuserdetailsmta-html5-service

  # - name: testgetuserdetailsmta-html5-runtime_new
  #   type: org.cloudfoundry.managed-service
  #   parameters:
  #     service: html5-apps-repo
  #     service-plan: app-runtime
  #     service-name: testgetuserdetailsmta-html5-runtime_new

  - name: testgetuserdetailsmta-destination-service
    type: org.cloudfoundry.managed-service
    parameters:
      service: destination
      service-plan: lite
      service-name: testgetuserdetailsmta-destination-service
      config:
        HTML5Runtime_enabled: true
        init_data:
          instance:
            destinations:
              - Name: ui5
                URL: https://ui5.sap.com
                Type: HTTP
                ProxyType: Internet
                Authentication: NoAuthentication
            existing_destinations_policy: update
        version: 1.0.0

  - name: testgetuserdetailsmta-xsuaa
    type: org.cloudfoundry.managed-service
    parameters:
      service: xsuaa
      service-plan: application
      service-name: testgetuserdetailsmta-xsuaa
      config:
        xsappname: testgetuserdetailsmta
        tenant-mode: dedicated
        scopes:
          - name: Display
            description: Display scope

parameters:
  deploy_mode: html5-repo
  enable-parallel-deployments: true

xs-app.json:
{
  "welcomeFile": "/index.html",
  "authenticationMethod": "route",
  "routes": [
    {
      "source": "^<apply-service-segment-path>/(.*)$",
      "target": "<apply-service-segment-path>/$1",
      "destination": "ui5",
      "authenticationType": "xsuaa",
      "csrfProtection": false
    },
    {
      "source": "^/resources/(.*)$",
      "target": "/resources/$1",
      "authenticationType": "none",
      "destination": "ui5"
    },
    {
      "source": "^/test-resources/(.*)$",
      "target": "/test-resources/$1",
      "authenticationType": "none",
      "destination": "ui5"
    },
    {
      "source": "^(.*)$",
      "target": "$1",
      "service": "html5-apps-repo-rt",
      "authenticationType": "xsuaa"
    },
    {
    "source": "^/user-api(.*)",
    "target": "$1",
    "service": "sap-approuter-userapi"
}

  ]
}
xs-security.json:
{
  "xsappname": "test.getuserdetailsmta",
  "tenant-mode": "dedicated",
  "description": "Security profile of called application",
  "scopes": [],
  "role-templates": []
}
ui5-deploy.yaml:
# yaml-language-server: $schema=https://sap.github.io/ui5-tooling/schema/ui5.yaml.json

specVersion: "4.0"
metadata:
  name: test.getuserdetailsmta
type: application
resources:
  configuration:
    propertiesFileSourceEncoding: UTF-8
builder:
  resources:
    excludes:
      - /test/**
      - /localService/**
  customTasks:
    - name: ui5-task-zipper
      afterTask: generateCachebusterInfo
      configuration:
        archiveName: testgetuserdetailsmta
        relativePaths: true
        additionalFiles:
          - xs-app.json
Can anyone assist on this?
 SAP BTP, Cloud Foundry runtime and environment SAP Build Work Zone, standard edition SAPUI5

entry.title: Issues with Joule AI on SAP SuccessFactors Test Instance & Customization of AI Instructions
entry.content:
Issues with Joule AI behavior and customization options

We have tested several times the Joule Joule AI implemented on our SAP SuccessFactor test instance, and we are repeatedly facing error messages such as:

  • “I’m sorry, but I can’t…”

  • "I am unable to ..."
  • “This action is not available at the moment”

(see screenshot attached below)

 

Could you please explain why these messages appear? We would like to understand whether this is related to system configuration, authorizations, current limitations of Joule, or the test environment.

In addition, we would like to know if it is possible to customize Joule’s instructions or responses.
For example, when asking “How can I create a job requisition?”, Joule provides the standard SAP SuccessFactors procedure, whereas we would like it to return our internal company process instead.

Is it possible to modify or configure Joule so that it uses company-specific procedures or documentation rather than the default SAP SuccessFactors guidance?

Finally, could you please let us know how to formally submit or escalate enhancement / evolution requests related to Joule AI (e.g. new functionalities, customization capabilities, or improvements)?

Thank you in advance.

entry.title: Is it possible to take SAP MaxDB Incremental backup during admin mode
entry.content: Can we take SAP MaxDB Incremental backup by maintaining admin mode of the database using third part tool??

entry.title: Datasource corrupted on fresh report
entry.content:
I create a new empty report in crystal report, select the database assistant and connect to a HANA procedure returning a table. If I call that procedure inside the studio with a DocKey and a DocumentID, I get a valid results. However, imediately after entering those same values in CR and hitting "Check dependencies", I get notified that the validation of said table has failed and that the report might be corrupted.

How can this be, what can I do?

BTW, doing the same with another proc'd Table works.

entry.title: Order to Cash Process
entry.content:
Hello,

Please, does SAP S/4 HANA public cloud support the below Order to Cash process and, how can it be implemented:

Sales Order ( with Shipping condition "TM – Int. Planning ")
   ↓
Outbound Delivery
   ↓
Post Goods Issue (Inventory- CR → Good-In-Transit - DR)
   ↓
Proof of Delivery (POD)
   ↓
GIT → COGS (Cr - Goods-In-Transit    DR - COGS )
   ↓
Billing (Revenue Recognition) (Revenue and Trade Receivable)

entry.title: Clarification on Differences Between SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition Demo Systems
entry.content:
We are currently evaluating SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition demo systems and would like to understand the differences between the following two options: https://www.sap.com/products/erp/s4hana.html#security

 

 

  1. Cloud test, demo, and development – one-system landscape

    • Is it possible to create and manage users and business roles in this system?

    • Are there any limitations regarding the number of users?

    • The offering mentions an Entitlements Package – what exactly does this include, and are there any functional or user limitations?

  2. Cloud test, demo, and development – three-system landscape

    • What are the key functional differences compared to the one-system landscape?

    • Why is a minimum of 100 FUE required?

    • Are there differences in user/role management or system separation (DEV/TEST/PROD)?

Our objective is to use the demo system for realistic user, role, and authorization modeling.

Thank you for your clarification.

Kind regards,
Rudi

entry.title: FPM Custom Page: How to parameterize value help in Macro FilterBar based on current object ID
entry.content:
Hello experts,

I am working with an FPM Custom Page that is accessed via internal navigation, where the page context is a single business object ID.

This page displays the main object along with several 1:n associated entities. For these associations, I am using a Macro FilterBar to allow the user to filter the results based on multiple fields.

The issue is related to value help (value list) behavior in the filter bar:

  • The value helps are generic and not context-aware.

  • They currently show all possible values, regardless of the selected business object ID.

  • As a result, users see value help entries that are not relevant for the current object context.

What I would like to achieve is:

  • Parameterize or filter the value help lists in the Macro FilterBar

  • So that the available values are restricted to those related to the current business object ID

  • Ideally done programmatically or via supported FPM mechanisms

I have checked the FPM Explorer and the API Reference, but I could not find a documented way to influence or filter the value help content of a Macro FilterBar based on the page context.

Is there a recommended or supported approach to:

  • Pass contextual parameters (such as the object ID) to value helps?

  • Or dynamically restrict value help entries in an FPM Custom Page?

Any guidance, hints, or architectural recommendations would be highly appreciated.

Thank you in advance

"equipment usage periods by functional locations" would be the most adequate. Is there an equivalent table to this?

Thank you.

entry.title: How to handle intercompany posting having intra company entries. Can we create a Admin Company?
entry.content:
For one of our middle east Country operations, we have a total of 8 company codes – Sao Company code A till company code H.
Now the company code A behaves as both an Admin company and an operating company.

So, for example when we do an allocation for a budget/expense, The funds are initially in Company code A and is the allocated to all other company code including self(via a separate profit center).

So when we post an intercompany accounting document , for example an allocation document, - the resultant document is a bit confusing as :
- Every IC Trading partner (TP D, C, D….) is now having a transaction with 2 profit centers of the Company code A 

In the entry view of this document, the 1st line is debited from and then paid -
1st to another account in same company code
and then to 7 other trading partner (i.e. other company codes)

Entry View

   

Account

 

Profit center

Amount

CC-A

 

PC-Admin

100

CC-A

 

PC-Op

-40

CC-B

  

-25

CC-C

  

-35

 

But when you go to General Ledger view its 2 line each for every trading partner i.e. every trading partner is interacting with 2 PCs from company code 2070.

GL View

   

Account

 

Profit center

Amount

CC-A

 

PC-Admin

100

CC-A

 

PC-Op

-40

CC-B

 

PC-Admin

-15

CC-B

 

PC-Op

-10

CC-C

 

PC-Admin

-21

CC-C

 

PC-Op

-14

Intra company clearing

PC-Op

40

Intra company clearing

PC-Admin

-40



So I have 2 questions :

Is there a way to setup this company codes so that we dont have the extra lines for each trading partner that interacts with Admin profit center from Company code A?

Alternatively, is there a possibility in SAP of setting up an ADMIN COMPANY CODE separate from existing 8 operating company codes and use it ? How and what is the impact of it?

entry.title: How to make standard Fiori apps open an extended Fiori app instead of the standard one?
entry.content:
Hello experts, good morning.

I would like to ask for your guidance regarding an issue we are facing while extending a standard Fiori application.

Context:
We were asked to extend a standard app in order to adjust a specific parameter within it. To achieve this, we used a SAPUI5 Adaptation Project from SAP Business Application Studio (BAS).

The required adjustments were successfully implemented, and the app was deployed correctly to our system. After that, the necessary Catalog, Group, and Role were created so the extended app could be used.

Initially, a custom (Z) Target Mapping was created for the extended app, based on the standard app’s target mapping, and everything was working as expected.

However, we later identified the following issue:

The standard app can be launched from other standard Fiori applications. When this navigation occurs, the standard app is always opened, but our requirement is for the extended app to be opened instead, so the requested change can be used.

To address this, we tried modifying the Target Mapping, keeping the same semantic object (or at least the same name), and removing the original target mapping, so that the apps performing the navigation would open the extended app.

This approach worked partially. For some users, the navigation opens the extended app correctly. However, when testing with other users who have more roles and profiles assigned, the system still opens the standard app instead of the extended one.

Additionally, we tried using the “Add SAP Fiori Launchpad Config” option available in SAP BAS:

However, this option does not seem to work, may be deprecated, or not supported in our system, as we receive a “URL Not Found” error.

In summary, my main question is:

How can I make standard Fiori applications open the extended app instead of the standard one?

We have already tried adjusting the target mapping and exploring Launchpad configurations, but without complete success. At this point, we have run out of ideas and would really appreciate any guidance.

Do you know of any alternative approach, recommended solution, or documentation that could help in this scenario?

Thank you for your time and for reading my question.
I look forward to your comments.

Best regards,
EBZ

entry.title: Provisioning Access After Ending Implementation Partner Engagement
entry.content:
We have recently ended our partnership with our SuccessFactors implementation partner.

Going forward, if any changes are required through Provisioning, could you please advise on the available options? We have a certified SuccessFactors consultant within our organization.

We would like to understand:

  1. Whether SAP can support us directly with Provisioning-related changes upon request, or

  2. Whether our in-house certified consultant can be granted access to Provisioning for our company’s SuccessFactors instances, subject to SAP approval.

Please let us know the recommended process and any prerequisites required.

Thank you for your support.

entry.title: Clarification on Long‑Term Safety of Using Custom Wrapper Classes for Compact Styling in Fiori Apps
entry.content:
Hello, For one of our Fiori applications, we need a more compact layout (smaller font size, reduced padding/margins, tighter table rows, etc...). To achieve this while staying within SAP‑recommended guidelines, we avoided modifying standard SAP classes.  Instead, we applied custom wrapper classes such as:  

CSS

 

controller.js

These custom classes are then added only to our List Report or Object Page root elements.

Before we continue with this approach for the long term, I would like to confirm:

  1. Is this approach (using custom wrapper/root classes around standard SAP controls) fully upgrade‑safe according to SAP guidelines?
    We are not changing .sapMBtn, .sapMLabel, .sapMTitle, or other standard selectors directly — only inside our own scope classes.

  2. Does SAP recommend any alternative technique for global compact styling of standard Fiori Elements applications?

entry.content:
Crystal Reports for Eclipse SP32 released on Jan 16, 2026, has the following high severity vulnerabilities:

CR4ERL32_0-80004572.ZIP: CrystalCommon2.jar - CVE-2001-1464
CR4ERL32_0-80004572.ZIP: CrystalReportsRuntime.jar - CVE-2001-1464
CR4ERL32_0-80004572.ZIP: webreporting.jar - CVE-2001-1464
CR4ERL32_0-80004572.ZIP: icu4j.jar - CVE-2020-10531
CR4ERL32_0-80004572.ZIP: icu4j.jar - CVE-2025-5222

Please indicate when these will be fixed or provide confirmation that they are false positives.

CRJAVA HIGH CVE

entry.title: Looking for Expert and Community Insights on My SAP Technical Journey
entry.content:
Hello everyone,

I hope you are all doing well.

I would like to kindly ask for your feedback and professional insights regarding my current learning journey within the SAP Technical domain. My goal is to continuously improve my technical profile and ensure that my learning path aligns well with real-world SAP projects and current market expectations.

Below is a brief overview of my learning direction and the reasoning behind each focus area.


SAP Technical Learning Direction At this stage, my primary focus is on pursuing the SAP Technical track. I am currently concentrating on SAP Basis, aiming to build a strong and solid foundation in SAP system administration, core architecture, and operational concepts.
In parallel, I am expanding my knowledge across several complementary technical areas, as outlined below:


SAP HANA
My objective is to gain a clear and comprehensive understanding of SAP HANA database architecture and how SAP systems interact with the database layer in terms of structure, performance optimization, and system integration.


SAP ABAP
I am working on building a solid understanding of the ABAP stack, with a focus on how development processes are designed and implemented within SAP systems. This helps me better understand system logic, debugging, and collaboration with development teams from a technical perspective.


SAP CPI (Cloud Integration)
My focus includes understanding SAP’s transition from traditional on-premise environments to cloud-based platforms, along with cloud integration concepts such as internal (A2A) and external (B2B) integration scenarios.

Additionally, I have complemented this learning path with the Apache Camel Framework, due to its importance and relevance within SAP integration solutions.


SAP UI5 / Fiori & SAP BTP CAPM
Recently, SAP introduced important updates related to both frontend and backend development models. I have been exploring these updates and following commonly recommended learning resources to better understand the modern SAP development approach, including CAP-based application development.


Learning Approach
Overall, I am intentionally following a structured and methodical learning sequence to build a holistic understanding of SAP Architecture as an integrated enterprise platform, rather than focusing on individual tools or isolated technologies.


Current Learning Path & Courses
Below are the main courses I am currently following (via Udemy):

SAP NetWeaver Fundamentals

SAP Basis Administration

SAP HANA Administration

Apache Camel Framework with Spring Boot

SAP Cloud Integration (CI / CPI), including API Management and Event Mesh

SAP UI5 / Fiori Full Stack with TypeScript / JavaScript using SAP BTP RAPM / CAPM


I would truly appreciate your feedback on whether this learning path is well-structured and aligned with real-world SAP implementations, and whether there are any key areas you would recommend adding, adjusting, or prioritizing differently.

Thank you in advance for your time and valuable insights.

Best regards,
